Learning landscape für das hessische Phy: Learning landscape for the Hessian Physics curriculum G9 (grades 7–10), encoded as a competence graph.
Oberziel für die Sekundarstufe I: Die le: Overarching goal for Secondary Level I: The learner masters the competencies described in the curriculum for grades 7 to 10.
Einstieg in zentrale Gebiete der Physik: Introduction to central areas of physics with everyday relevance and experiments.
Vertiefung Optik und Elektrizität, fakul: Deepening of Optics and Electricity, optional focal points.
Strukturierung übergreifender Konzepte w: Structuring overarching concepts such as energy and radioactivity.
Lichtphänomene mit Strahlenmodell erkund: Explore light phenomena with the ray model.
Die lernende Person kann grundlegende Be: The learner can describe basic observations regarding light, shadows, and rectilinear propagation.
Die lernende Person kann Lichtwege mit d: The learner can represent light paths with the ray model and predict simple light paths.
Die lernende Person kann Reflexion an gl: The learner can investigate reflection on smooth surfaces, apply the law of reflection, and interpret mirror images.
Temperatur, Wärme und Teilchenmodell ver: Understand temperature, heat, and particle model.
Die lernende Person kann Temperatur als: The learner can distinguish temperature as a state variable from the sensation of heat and name heat sources.
Die lernende Person kann Temperatur mess: The learner can measure temperature and describe the expansion of solids, liquids, and gases upon temperature change.
Die lernende Person kann Temperaturänder: The learner can qualitatively explain temperature changes using the particle model.
Die lernende Person kann Wärmeleitung, K: The learner can distinguish heat conduction, convection, and thermal radiation and assign examples.
Grundlegende Magnet- und Stromphänomene: Explore basic magnetic and current phenomena.
Die lernende Person kann Pole und Kräfte: The learner can describe poles and forces of magnets and use the concept of elementary magnets.
Die lernende Person kann Leitfähigkeit p: The learner can test conductivity, create closed and open circuits, and apply circuit symbols.
Die lernende Person kann magnetische, Li: The learner can qualitatively describe magnetic, light, thermal, and chemical effects of current.
Die lernende Person kann ein Amperemeter: The learner can connect an ammeter and measure currents in simple circuits.
Die lernende Person kann Volumen, Masse: The learner can determine and compare volume, mass, and density of bodies.
Die lernende Person kann gleichförmige u: The learner can describe uniform and accelerated movements and interpret distance-time diagrams.
Die lernende Person kann Änderungen von: The learner can explain changes in states of motion through forces and describe inertia.
Die lernende Person kann Kräfte zusammen: The learner can compose forces, recognize proportionalities, and describe lines of action.
Die lernende Person kann Reibungskräfte: The learner can qualitatively interpret friction forces and explain their role in locomotion.
Linsenabbildung, Auge und optische Gerät: Understand lens imaging, the eye, and optical instruments.
Die lernende Person kann Konvex- und Kon: The learner can describe convex and concave lenses, state focal length, and construct images.
Die lernende Person kann den Sehvorgang: The learner can explain the vision process in the eye and qualitatively explain nearsightedness and farsightedness.
Die lernende Person kann einfache optisc: The learner can describe simple optical instruments like telescopes or microscopes or build models of them.
Stromkreise systematisch analysieren und: Analyze circuits systematically and use them safely.
Die lernende Person kann Ladungstrennung: The learner can describe charge separation, measure voltage, and interpret the capacitor as charge storage.
Die lernende Person kann Stromstärke und: The learner can measure current and voltage and qualitatively explain their relationship.
Die lernende Person kann Reihen- und Par: The learner can plan series and parallel circuits, use Kirchhoff's laws, and interpret resistors.
Die lernende Person kann Gefahren elektr: The learner can explain dangers of electrical systems, explain behavior during thunderstorms, and assess household circuits.
Die lernende Person kann Druck als Kraft: The learner can describe pressure as force per area and cite examples from technology and everyday life.
Die lernende Person kann qualitative Zus: The learner can explain qualitative relationships between pressure and temperature changes.
Die lernende Person kann das Archimedisc: The learner can apply Archimedes' principle and explain buoyancy in water and air.
Die lernende Person kann Auftrieb an Tra: The learner can qualitatively describe lift on airfoils and air resistance.
Schallentstehung, Ausbreitung und Wahrne: Describe sound generation, propagation, and perception.
Die lernende Person kann Schall als Schw: The learner can understand sound as vibration and name examples for sources and receivers.
Die lernende Person kann Schallausbreitu: The learner can interpret sound propagation in the particle model and compare sound perception.
Die lernende Person kann Ton, Geräusch,: The learner can distinguish and represent tone, noise, volume, and pitch.
Die lernende Person kann den Aufbau des: The learner can explain the structure of the ear and assess the effects of noise.
Die lernende Person kann Schallphänomene: The learner can describe sound phenomena on musical instruments and explain sound design.
Die lernende Person kann Farbzerlegung m: The learner can explain color decomposition with a prism or color wheel and interpret white as a composite color.
Die lernende Person kann additive und su: The learner can distinguish additive and subtractive color mixing and apply examples.
Die lernende Person kann Alltagserfahrun: The learner can describe everyday experiences of color perception.
Die lernende Person kann technische Anwe: The learner can explain technical applications such as color printing or screen colors.
Mechanische und elektrische Energieforme: Understand mechanical and electrical forms of energy.
Die lernende Person kann einfache Maschi: The learner can describe simple machines as force transducers and qualitatively interpret efficiency.
Die lernende Person kann Rollen und Räde: The learner can explain pulleys and wheels as aids for force saving.
Die lernende Person kann mechanische Ene: The learner can distinguish forms of mechanical energy and qualitatively represent energy conversions.
Wärme als Energieform: Heat as a Form of Energy
Die lernende Person kann Wärme als Energ: The learner can classify heat as a form of energy and explain simple energy balances.
Die lernende Person kann elektrische Ene: The learner can describe electrical energy conversions and evaluate applications.
Bausteine des Atoms und radioaktive Stra: Get to know building blocks of the atom and radioactive radiation.
Die lernende Person kann Kern und Hülle: The learner can qualitatively describe the nucleus and shell of the atom and estimate orders of magnitude.
Die lernende Person kann Arten radioakti: The learner can name types of radioactive radiation, describe detection methods, and assess effects.
Die lernende Person kann Anwendungen und: The learner can discuss applications and risks in medicine, technology, or nuclear energy.
